column4: Tom: your issue is what, that your system doesn't login automatically?
It is supposed to login automaticly, but the problem is that it does not boot up... I can'T access it via ssh either..
you might try a server distro of Ubuntu.  Technically, I don't think Intrepid lets you SSH into the system unless it's logged in - that's how my laptop works.
but when I boot it up with a monitor it logs automatically and everything is fine. It's only when I unplug the monitor ..
that IS pretty odd.  if I had to guess X is trying to detect your monitor in a way that doesn't fail gracefully on your video card, check /var/log/Xorg.0.log
Aah!  My bad.  Try /var/log/Xorg.0.log.old
the last line is: (II) UnloadModule: "evdev"
it's screaming about no mouse and keyboard, but nothing about the monitor, I'll pastebin the logs
that's a good idea and what I was about to suggest.
out of curiosity what happens when you boot the system and then plug the monitor in?
everything works fine, flawlessly. ssh, login, gnome, etc.. vnc too
http://pastebin.com/m342f4d3e
all that stuff works... even if you boot up without the monitor and add it later but -not- until you add the monitor?
it seems to freeze or stop somewhere. I then reboot with a monitor plugged in and it works.
okay.  one moment.
a couple questions about the log output if I may - first, is that /var/log/Xorg.0.conf or /var/log/Xorg.conf.old?
it's the .log.old
okay.  the way it works is that when you boot, the log.old is deleted and Xorg.0.log is renamed to Xorg.0.log.old.  so this log is only from the failed boot if you'd only booted successfully once.
yep I gave you the defective log

neat.  It seems like X is starting fine, so I may be out of ideas.  Although - have you tried the closed-source nvidia driver?  it's vaguely possible that the nv driver chokes somewhere after xorg load when no monitor is present.
you running Intrepid?
if you wanna see more logs: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1092912
